abstract: The rational for using remote sensing in land use/land cover, geomorphology, and cartography applications is stated as well as potential uses in each of these areas. The next step to be perfected is indicated. Spatial and spectral resolution requirements for photointerpretations and/or multispectral pattern recognition of geomorphic elements and of cultural surface cover are listed. Requirements for photographic/analog or digital photogrammetry from spaceborne multispectral linear array sensors are included. A prioritized summary of data gaps in the geographic sciences is included.
title: Geographic science team

publications.publicationName: The Multispectral Imaging Science Working Group, Vol. 3

related.title: The Multispectral Imaging Science Working Group. Volume 3: Appendices
